results.title: The Teacher and the Computer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
Teacher, Anne McDougall, talks about the introduction of computers into education and the relationship of the teacher and the computer, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne, October 16-18, 1980.

results.title: That Hamilton woman
results.creator_credit: Alexander Korda and Alexander Korda Films
results.brief_description: That Hamilton woman opens in France, where a destitute and alcoholic woman is arrested for stealing. The woman in question is Lady Emma Hamilton (Vivien Leigh), a once famed beauty. In jail, Emma tells her story to a cellmate, casting back to a time when she was young and lovely. An English woman born to a low class, with a past riddled with infamy, Emma had managed to rise above her station. In Naples Emma is a guest of Sir William Hamilton, a British ambassador, who offers her a financially secure but loveless marriage, to which she agrees. Emma is received at court and revels in the social status of being Lady Hamilton. One day her world is upended with the arrival of Lord Nelson (Laurence Olivier), a British naval hero. Over the course of several years, Emma and Nelson are shown to have a growing affection for one another which blossoms into love. Both are in loveless marriages but divorce is impossible and society views their union with scorn. Leigh excels as Hamilton, a brave woman, beaten by societal mores of the day. The film caused a scandal in America for its depiction of adultery, and dialogue was added to portray the lovers as suffering for their indiscretions.

results.title: Zoo babies
results.brief_description: Join Channel TEN’s Lynday Davies as she follows the lives of baby animals at Sydney’s Taronga and Western Plains Zoos. The zoo witnesses the birth of many babies throughout the year, with thousands of new additions to the zoo ‘family’. You’ll see the birth of a baby gorilla and giraffe, as well as an assortment of all creatures great and small who are cared for by zoo staff.

results.title: Youth of Japan
results.brief_description: Like young people everywhere, the youth of modern Japan display vision, hope and enthusiasm for life and strength of purpose. This is illustrated by impressions of the lives of a typical young factory worker, shop assistant and student.

results.title: Your silent partner
results.creator_credit: O.J. Wrightson and Tasmania. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Outlines methods of fodder conservation on the dairy farm. The cow may be regarded as a milk factory and if food is in short supply or of the wrong type, milk production will be reduced. The composition of milk is used to illustrate the need for a balanced diet and how such a diet can be obtained from different types of fodder. The latter sections of the film illustrate methods of making grass silage and meadow hay to provide a reserve of fodder for use throughout the year.

results.title: Your richest gift
results.brief_description: A good industrial safety record is the result of co-operation between management and employees. Safety equipment and safe working habits are necessary to prevent accidents. To protect the eyes safety glasses or goggles should be worn at all times. Shows the safety procedures operating at the Owens-Illinois factory.

results.title: Your obedient servant
results.brief_description: To the layman the world of the computer is surrounded by mystery. This film contends that it should be as acceptable in modern life as are the telephone and television. Man is master and a computer cannot work correctly unless each step is logically planned.
